item.description:
Boston By Foot's Literary Landmarks Walking Tour focuses on the 19th century literary figures and sites of Boston. This rare event is a thematic continuation of literary topics through the 20th century.

The 19th-century literary flowering on Beacon Hill provided strong roots for the growth of 20th-century literature. Even as the quill pen gave way to the typewriter, the literary spirit continued in such notables as poet Robert Frost, historians Samuel Eliot Morison and David McCullough, and medical novelist Robin Cook. This tour takes a look at how literary life in Boston changed - and how it didn't - from one century through the next.

The tour meets outside the Park Street T Station on the Common. Tickets are $15 ($5 for Boston By Foot card holders).

Go to www.bostonbyfoot.org for information on becoming a member.
item.how_to_find_us: Guides will be outside the T station on the plaza.
item.name: Literary Landmarks II
